revised_title: Henry Woods: A Pioneering Geologist and Palaeontologist
tldr: Henry Woods was a prominent geologist and palaeontologist who made significant contributions to the study of Cretaceous rocks and their fauna. He worked at Cambridge University and was known for his caution and focus on established facts in morphology and distribution. Woods authored several editions of the influential book 'Palaeontology; Invertebrate,' which helped shape the teaching of palaeontology in the early 20th century.
